items.message:
"River levels are forecast to rise at the Pillings Lock river gauge as a result of persistent rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible and is forecast to begin between 16:00 and midnight, today, 22/07/23.  Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Slash Lane at Sileby and the Mountsorrel to Sileby road.   
  We expect river levels to remain high for the next 3 or 4 days 
We are closely monitoring the situation.  
Please plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses.  
This message will be updated by 20:00 this evening, 22/07/23, or as the situation changes."
